post.description:
Returns information of a SIGN session. If no asyncRespID is precised in request, creates a new session. If asyncRespID is precised, retrieves information for the corresponding session. 
Here is described the minimal set of data required for processing. 
Additionally, DSS standards describe other parameter as mandatory inputs but are not required in the processing – for example the "transforms" lists 
DSS limitations: we don't want multiple hash under di, only the one hash we have to compute a signature for.

400.description: Returned in case of invalid request object

post.summary: Start a new user identification session
post.description: Creates a new user identification session. To have the status of this one or collect the user's certificate, partner must call the 'status' endpoint

400.description: Returned in case of invalid request object

post.summary: Get the status of a user identification session
post.description: Get the status of an existing user identification session based on the 'asyncRespID' argument in the POST body

400.description: Returned in case of invalid request object

alg.description: Algorithm used for the hash. Only sha256 is supported for now

value.description: Hash to be signed by ItsMe QES solution in a signature flow

id.description: Identifier of the hash series to be signed during signature flow

di.description: Array of hashes to sign during a signature flow. However, multiple hash signing is not yet supported : This array can only contain one hash to sign

signPolicyRef.description:
Reference of the signing policy to use during BMID Signing flow. 
Optional but recommended. The list of available codes is communicated by BMID through well-known configuration endpoint 
A default policy (the itsme generic signature policy) will be applied if not provided

commitmentTypeRef.description:
Reference of the commitment type to use during BMID Signing flow. 
Only used to show the user in the itsme app the commitment type of the signature  
Optional: the code of the commitment to be used (list of available codes communicated by BMID) 
No commitment will be used if not provided

signerRole.description:
Signer's role during BMID Signing flow. 
Only used to show the user in the itsme app with what role he will be signing 
Optional: a signer role – free text value  
A value must be provided for each of the 4 supported languages 
max 50 chars, only ISO-8859-1 compatible chars are supported 
No signer role will be used if not provided

signer.description: Identifying information of the signer in ItsMe solution

partnerCode.description: partnerCode (communicated by BMID) of the partner that needs to be be visualized in the app to the user and who delivers the userCode for the specific user

serviceCode.description: serviceCode (communicated by BMID) for the specific hash signing service of the partner who delivers the userCode for the specific user

description.description:
A description about the data to be signed that will be shown to the end user in his itsme app. 
A value must be provided for each of the supported languages 
max 50 chars, only ISO-8859-1 compatible chars are supported

redirectUrl.description:
URL used at the end of the BMID signing flow to redirect user to the remote SCA. 
After visiting this URL, the remote SCA should call QES Partners API to check the status of signature. 
The value of this redirectUrl must correspond to the remote SCA's SIGN service created during its onboarding

signPolicy.description:
Signature policy information. 
Optional, however if the SCA indicates itself the use of a signature policy to the user, the SCA MUST use this element to inform BMID about this to avoid that another signature policy will be referenced in the itsme app than in the SCA. If no specific signature policy is used by the SCA, the SCA should use the itsme generic signature policy

signingUrl.description: Link to provide to the end user where he will receive BMID instructions and poka yoke code

userCode.description:
User's identifier for the remote SCA in ItsMe solution. 
Mandatory for hash signing request

docHash.description:
List of hashes to be signed by the ItsMe solution. 
1 item per hash (could be multiple in the future, multiple hashes in the request are not yet supported at this moment) 
id of the element will be reused later when providing the signature response to link the returned information with the hash it was created for
